page.title: 08WALKS
page.content: My favourite walk takes you through the High street and down School Hill, on the way you pass several houses, six fields, a shed, a sign post and a farm. If you turn right you will pass more fields and cross a stile; you are almost at Bateman's. Take a left past another field and a car park, cross over the bridge with a stream below it, pass two more fields and a stile, after this you can see the Water-mill and Bateman's gardens' come into view. The mill pond is clearly visible and you can hear the mill-race as the water enters the narrow part where the mill wheel scoops up the water to drive the grind stones. Then you cross another field and a stream, a weir can be heard before you can see it, then you go into a wood and step onto a bridge, this is the River Dudwell that meets the sea at Rye.
